Knowledge System Operations Manual

Overview

This manual defines operational procedures for a local-first knowledge system. It covers ingestion, indexing, retrieval, synthesis, and audit workflows. The objective is to ensure reliability, traceability, and maintainability across routine and high-load usage scenarios.

Operators should follow the sequence in this document and record deviations in run logs. Every process step assumes explicit source tracking and verifiable outcomes to reduce ambiguity during incident review.

Prerequisites

  • Storage: writable local persistence directory and sufficient disk space.
  • Embedding runtime: configured model with validated dimension consistency.
  • Parsing stack: handlers for TXT, MD, HTML, PDF, and DOCX input.

Operational Workflow

Step 1

Procedure: Validate input manifests, parse documents, and preserve structural boundaries before chunk generation. During this stage, quality checks confirm that headings, paragraph transitions, and metadata values remain aligned with source artifacts.

Control: Apply deterministic chunk identifiers, attach provenance fields, and persist ingestion summaries for later audits. If a conflict appears between index state and manifest state, halt updates and investigate before continuing.

Threshold Table

MetricTargetEscalation Condition
Chunk parse success>= 99%Escalate if lower for two runs.
Query latency p95< 1.5sEscalate if above threshold after warm cache.
Citation validity>= 95%Escalate if unsupported claims increase.
